data.title: Launch electron debug stopped working?
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.2
- OS Version: Windows 10
- Electron Version: 1.7

Steps to Reproduce:

I did an NPM update for electron, and a few other modules, and the Debug Launch of Electron stopped working. However, I can still manually start Electron from the command prompt, and it seems that the same command is what VSCODE is doing.

I.e. this works:

```
> d:\wwwroot\librarian2017\dashboard/node_modules/.bin/electron.cmd --debug-brk=24964 --nolazy main.js 
```

But I get the message (below) when I run launch.json, and the blue status bar at the bottom of the VSCODE window turns orange for a second and then goes back to blue. No indication of what crashed. But nothing pops up.


```
Debugging with legacy protocol because a runtime executable is set.
d:\wwwroot\librarian2017\dashboard/node_modules/.bin/electron.cmd --debug-brk=24964 --nolazy main.js 
```
**Launch.json**
```
{
    "version": "0.2.0",
    "configurations": [
        {
            "type": "node",
            "request": "launch",
            "name": "DashBoard",
            "program": "${workspaceRoot}/main.js",
            "stopOnEntry": false,
            "args": [],
            "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}",
            "runtimeExecutable": "${workspaceRoot}/node_modules/.bin/electron.cmd",
            "env": {},
            "sourceMaps": true
        }
  
```

data.title: Error parsing Regex during search and replace: Not a valid base 10 number
data.body:
When using the Find and Replace function in VSCode, I found a regular expression that VSCode does not seem to be able to handle. I successfully tested it on http://regexr.com and also within the Adobe Brackets editor, and the regex works fine.

On VSCode, the error presented is: _'Error parsing regex near [....] Not a valid base 10 number_ [.......]' See screenshot for full details of error.

- VSCode Version: Version 1.12.1 (1.12.1)
- OS Version: Mac OS X El Capitan v. 10.11.6

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Go to Find and Replace
2. Select the regular expressions option
3. Enter the following query: (import {)\s*([^\n\r\s].*[^\n\r\s])\s*(} from ')
This query is to find all `import {MyComponent}` code that don't have spaces in it.
Old: `import {MyComponent}` and new: `import { MyComponent }`
The plan was to use the replace as `$1 $2 $3` but an error appeared: _'Error parsing regex near [....] Not a valid base 10 number [.......]'_ See screenshot for full details of error.

![screen shot 2017-05-15 at 2 09 29 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22302818/26079824/fc9c6bec-3978-11e7-8ea3-85a9762e055b.png)

data.title: Use getDomNodePagePosition to position suggest docs
data.body:
Fixes #26324
Fixes #26416
Fixes #26224

In this PR, `getDomNodePagePosition` is used to get the top and left offset of the cursor relative to VS Code window. These values are then compared to suggest widget's top and left offsets. Based on this comparison, we take the call whether we should show docs to the right/left of the list or show them one below the other

data.body: Copied from issue of string "using external program" https://www.transifex.com/microsoft-oss/vscode-editor/translate/#zh-Hans/$/111166734?issue=yes "Open image using external program?" sentence should not be split to translate it correctly. Please redirect to right person if this is fixable.

data.title: Explorer stealing space keypresses while terminal is focused
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.13.0-insider (bed4aad1e055eda2f5d864bbba6968ea77262b1c, 2017-05-15T06:09:48.271Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.10.0-20-generic
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|EditorConfig|EditorConfig|0.9.3|
|lorem-ipsum|Tyriar|1.0.0|
|sort-lines|Tyriar|1.2.0|
|theme-sapphire|Tyriar|0.2.1|
|vscode-svgviewer|cssho|1.4.0|
|tslint|eg2|0.15.0|
|git-project-manager|felipecaputo|1.3.2|
|md-navigate|jrieken|0.0.1|
|vscode-scss|mrmlnc|0.6.2|
|seti-icons|qinjia|0.1.3|;

---

Not sure how I got into this state, but pressing <kbd>space</kbd> while the terminal is focused (blinking cursor) is toggling the folder in explorer.

![out](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2193314/26078507/9dade5ba-3974-11e7-8151-0e45b54acbd0.gif)

Clicking the explorer and back to the terminal fixed the issue.

@bpasero for workbench
@sandy081 for recent custom explorer changes

Will probably be difficult to repro, close off if there's not enough info for a fix.

data.title: JSON schemas served with gzip fail to parse
data.body:
VSCode Version: 1.12.1, 1.13.0 (latest vscode repo)
OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
Create a test.json with the following content:
```
{
    "$schema": "https://statics.teams.microsoft.com/sdk/v1.0/manifest/MicrosoftTeams.schema.json"
}
```

This file is gzipped, and it doesn't look like VSCode (or an underlying lib) is decompressing it.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6445614/26076661/53cd3244-396e-11e7-933c-260de775c6bf.png)

Debugging into jsonSchemaService.ts (from the vscode-json-languageservice repo):
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6445614/26076607/29095a38-396e-11e7-9e2b-bbdb61857ed7.png)

data.title: `find` runs with 100% CPU
data.body:
Some of the time when I use vscode i get a second process `find` that runs with 100% CPU usage (I have 12 CPUs so it is just 12,5% ; but it keep my fans running).

- VSCode Version: 1.12.1 [ f6868fce3eeb16663840eb82123369dec6077a9b ]
- OS Version: Linux Arch ; build from source

Activated extensions:
- C# - 1.9.0
- Docker - 0.0.13
- HTML Snippets - 0.1.0
- LaTeX Compile - 0.7.0
- LaTeX Language Support - 0.1.3

data.title: Autocomplete inserts newline when it should not
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Version 1.12.1 (1.12.1)
- OS Version: macOS Sierra 10.12.4

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create an identifier
2. Type the whole word of that identifier
3. Press return to dismiss the autocomplete box
4. A newline is inserted instead of the box simply being dismissed

![screen recording 2017-05-15 at 12 38 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/70804/26073202/5ba55d78-396b-11e7-9afb-d9dcd20b378d.gif)

data.title: Suggestion: Add native visual indicator of extra sequential blank spaces on JS Files
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version:

> Version 1.12.1
> Commit f6868fce3eeb16663840eb82123369dec6077a9b
> Date 2017-05-04T21:40:39.245Z
> Shell 1.6.6
> Renderer 56.0.2924.87
> Node 7.4.0

- OS Version:

> DISTRIB_ID=Ubuntu
> DISTRIB_RELEASE=17.04
> DISTRIB_CODENAME=zesty
> DISTRIB_DESCRIPTION="Ubuntu 17.04"
> NAME="Ubuntu"
> VERSION="17.04 (Zesty Zapus)"
> ID=ubuntu
> ID_LIKE=debian
> PRETTY_NAME="Ubuntu 17.04"
> VERSION_ID="17.04"
> HOME_URL="https://www.ubuntu.com/"
> SUPPORT_URL="https://help.ubuntu.com/"
> BUG_REPORT_URL="https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/"
> PRIVACY_POLICY_URL="https://www.ubuntu.com/legal/terms-and-policies/privacy-policy"
> VERSION_CODENAME=zesty
> UBUNTU_CODENAME=zesty
> 

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Edit Multiple JavaScript files 
2. Only see extra sequential blank spaces on git diff
3. Suggestion: Add native visual indicator of extra sequential blank spaces on JS Files

Sorry if duplicated or irrelevant.
Thank.

data.title: URLSearchParams was not checking during compiling
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version:1.12.0
  Commit f6868fce3eeb16663840eb82123369dec6077a9b 
  Date 2017-05-04T21:26:50:689Z
  Shell 1.6.6
  Renderer 56.0.2924.87
  Node 7.4.
- OS Version:  Windows 7 Ulitmate
Steps to Reproduce:

1. Compiled and running are OK with importing URLSearchParams. 

```js
import { Http, Response, Headers, RequestOptions, URLSearchParams, RequestMethod } from '@angular/http';
...
let p = new URLSearchParams();
...
```

2. After remove URLSearchParams from "import", running is not correct, but compiled is OK without any message for showing should be to import "URLSearchParams".

data.title: Crash in rendering

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 Creators Update

For some reasons (not sure what it is) a version that worked on Friday doesn't launch anymore today. Using `--verbose` and enabling both `ELECTRON_ENABLE_STACK_DUMPING` and `ELECTRON_ENABLE_LOGGING`, I'm getting the following output:

```
[93m[main 10:39:23 AM][0m Starting VS Code in verbose mode
[93m[main 10:39:23 AM][0m from: c:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code\resources\app
[93m[main 10:39:23 AM][0m args: { _: [],
  help: false,
  h: false,
  version: false,
  v: false,
  wait: false,
  w: false,
  diff: false,
  d: false,
  goto: false,
  g: false,
  'new-window': false,
  n: false,
  'unity-launch': false,
  'reuse-window': false,
  r: false,
  performance: false,
  p: false,
  'prof-startup': false,
  verbose: true,
  logExtensionHostCommunication: false,
  'disable-extensions': false,
  disableExtensions: false,
  'list-extensions': false,
  'show-versions': false,
  nolazy: false }
[93m[main 10:39:24 AM][0m IPC#vscode-machineId
Backtrace:
        (No symbol) [0x0485D3C4]
        (No symbol) [0x011BA14E]
[VS Code]: render process crashed!
[93m[main 10:39:26 AM][0m Lifecycle#window-all-closed
[93m[main 10:39:26 AM][0m Lifecycle#before-quit
[93m[main 10:39:26 AM][0m App#will-quit: disposing resources
```

I'll install the insider version to see if it behaves better.

data.title: Add .git/subtree-cache/ to files.watcherExclude
data.body:
In my local Linux kernel repo, this folder has a bunch of 1.9GB subfolders, which really chews up CPU.

Since this is a cache, there should not be any harm in ignoring it by default. And that way in rare cases like mine, this will make vscode will "just work" by not using a bunch of CPU and RAM for no good reason.

data.title: Watch List not working c++
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.12.1
- OS Version:Mac El Capitan

Steps to Reproduce:

1. I updated (1.12.1) 
2. I opened my c++ project that I previously debugged and pushed play.
3. Adding an item to the watch list just sits there trying to load.  Hovering over items also does not work.

This worked fine just before my update.
